channel.title: ATI's 58xx Series
channel.description:
I have decided to grab all the information i have found so far on these cards and put it into this thread. These cards are amazing and are going to push nvidia into the dirt for awhile.
[img]http://i28.tinypic.com/2gt16v5.png[/img]
Nvidias GTX285 (the worlds current fastest single video card) vs ATI Radeon 5870.
[img]http://www.techpowerup.com/img/09-09-14/137c.jpg[/img]
same, but vsing the 5850.
[img]http://www.techpowerup.com/img/09-09-14/137d.jpg[/img]
Single 5870 vs GTX285 (a dual chip card, containing 2x overclocked GTX275s)
[img]http://i305.photobucket.com/albums/nn237/kylzer/oho6qa.png[/img]
FPS charts from the GTX285 vs 5850
[img]http://i26.tinypic.com/sqt3yp.png[/img]
2x GTX295s (4x 275s) vs 2x 5870s
[img]http://i32.tinypic.com/58it1.png[/img]
Also the drivers the ATI cards are using are like the first batch, up against 1 year old Nvidia drivers. Still a lot of performance left in these as ATI work on the drivers.
enjoy.

item.title: ATI's 58xx Series
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

http://www.overclockers.co.uk/productlist.php?groupid=701&catid=56&sortby=nameAsc&subid=1502&mfrid=

The 5850 and 5870 are out… the intial reviews have been good… but i was kind of expecting more. I’m not sure on what i’ll be buying now when i order the rest of the stuff for my new build next month. Thinking of just sticking with GTX295…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 30, 2009, 08:28:05 pm[/size][hr]So nothing else to say on this? I think i’ve decided on getting two 5850’s, in the benchmarks they’re quite close to two 5870’s - but for £200 less and a smaller form factor.

Read full topic

item.title: ATI's 58xx Series
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

the 5850 is supposed to be on par, or 10% faster than the 4870x2 (ATI’s fastest card before this series) as well as a dual card. 5870 matches the GTX295 (also nvidias fastest card right now, and double chip) whilst this 5870 is a single chip… just imagine a 5890x2. I’m gonna grab me one of these 5870s when they reach around 250-300$

Read full topic

item.title: ATI's 58xx Series
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

chrisn2323:

the 4th chart compares to the gtx295…

You’re correct, didn’t notice. xEnt wrote it as 5870 vs GTX 285 but that’s incorrect.
5850 vs GTX 285, 5870 vs GTX 295.

Read full topic

item.title: ATI's 58xx Series
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Moparisthebest:

They both have spin doctors whose only job is to spin things.

Surprising considering the job title.

Read full topic

item.title: ATI's 58xx Series
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:14, topic:302378”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=398705.msg2959020#msg2959020 date=1253044985]

Thing is, they aren’t comparing it to the GTX 295, which I believe is their most powerful card so far.
Also, any data on the rig used to test this on?

GTX 295 has two GPUs. This is putting it against their top of the line single card.

So? Like Thug-life said, they are comparing nvidia’s best SINGLE card against ATi’s DUAL 4870’s…

They have to spin it in their favor don’t they? Damn fanboys.
[/quote]Nvidia does the same thing but worse.[/quote]

Sure, of course both companies do the same thing. You wouldn’t expect ATI to do all these studies and say “so in conclusion, ATI cards are equal to nvidia cards, or possibly only slightly better, but that isn’t conclusive”

You wouldn’t expect nvidia to do it either. They both have spin doctors whose only job is to spin things.

Read full topic

I’ll be putting a new PC together towards the end of this year/start of next, i was thinking of the GTX295, but now seeing this, i’m not sure if i should.

And wait, why are they comparing the 4870x2 but not the GTX295, they’re both dual gpu boards, right?

item.description:
@Holic wrote:

item.title: ATI's 58xx Series
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

299$ for 5850, 399$ for 5870. simply because theres no challenge from nvidia at the moment. wait 3-4 months when nvidia release their new shit, and ATI should slash their prices by 35% or so.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 14, 2009, 07:28:01 pm[/size][hr]they also use less than half the power of a GTX295, and to build one of these things is cheaper than the 48xx series (so they have a lot of price room to drop around).

Read full topic

I have decided to grab all the information i have found so far on these cards and put it into this thread. These cards are amazing and are going to push nvidia into the dirt for awhile.
